notes.note: Starting with Firefox 122, the URL Paste Suggestion feature is now enabled by default in Nightly builds. This enhancement provides a convenient way for users to quickly visit URLs copied to the clipboard in the address bar of desktop Firefox. When the clipboard contains a URL, and the user focuses on the URL bar, an autocomplete result appears automatically. Activating the clipboard suggestion will navigate the user to the URL with 1 click.
Starting with Firefox 120, ULPFE/RED is now on by default for video in Nightly builds. This provides additional protection against packet loss for video during WebRTC calls.

Firefox now supports animating the SVG  [viewBox][1] attribute using [SMIL][2] `by animations`. `by animations` are animations that are relative to the original value. Other attributes such as lengths and angles already support `by`, but a `viewBox` consists of four separate values.

[1]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/viewBox
[2]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/SVG_animation_with_SMIL

The [LargestContentfulPaint API][1] has been added, this provides timing information about the largest image or text paint before users interact with a web page.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/LargestContentfulPaint
`<hr>-in-<select>` is now supported, allowing websites to easily use separators inside a `<select>` element.

Starting with Firefox 122,  the `popover` attribute is now supported by default in Nightly builds. The [popover][1] global attribute is used to designate an element as a popover element. The element won't render until it becomes shown, it will then render on top of other page content.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/popover

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio
text:
Firefox Nightly gets updated every day and as a consequence, the release notes for the Nightly channel are updated continuously to reflect features that have reached sufficient maturity to benefit from community feedback and bug reports. 

**Warning: Features listed here may or may *not* make a final release of Firefox.**

In addition to these release notes, you can follow ongoing development on our [@FirefoxNightly][1] Twitter account, our  [@FirefoxNightly@mozilla.social][4] Mastodon account as well as read our [Nightly Blog][2].

You can interact with other Firefox Nightly users and give your feedback to Mozilla staff in the [Nightly Matrix room][3] on chat.mozilla.org.


  [1]: https://twitter.com/FirefoxNightly
  [2]: https://blog.nightly.mozilla.org
  [3]: https://chat.mozilla.org/?#/room/#nightly:mozilla.org
  [4]: https://mozilla.social/@FirefoxNightly
title: Firefox 122.0a1 Nightly
